post.title: https://youtu.be/wAyaGYxv5-M
post.body: _"We can change the value of creativity by looking at everything as creativity instead."_ **-Peter Sunde** >BitTorrent is a protocol for distributing files. It identifies content by URL and is designed to integrate seamlessly with the web. Its advantage over plain HTTP is that when multiple downloads of the same file happen concurrently, the downloaders upload to each other, making it possible for the file source to support very large numbers of downloaders with only a modest increase in its load. http://www.bittorrent.org/beps/bep_0003.html

Ok, so I'm thinking perhaps the !C confused deputy problem (wikipedia) will work to load this image when the page is viewed from a proxy. We throw an image tag, that would absolutely break if you were loading this blog from 0net, but might work through a proxy.. bit.no.com | oh, neat
_what if: 0net proxy → !cnet 0net proxy (such meta, wow)_

post.title: Facebook can't see 0net pages through a proxy (yet)
post.body:
Metatags on the zeronet, do they matter? They should if you plan to plan ahead. Currently, there are really only a few projects that would index the network (like zerosearch.bit, 0list.bit, , ), and none really that grab and use page content for search UX. Though I'm sure that one day, it'll be commonplace.

What I'm suggesting, is that even though it's not relevant to conform, soon it very well may be. Find a way to get your ducks in a row before the proverbial hammer _(or spider-friendly proxy)_ drops, improve that rank before it matters.

Here's where I'll be looking to update my blog.

  • !C google meta tags
  • !C bing webmaster guidelines
  • !C facebook best practices
  • !C twitter cards

---

post.title: XBL cross compatibility
post.body: All this hype about cross platform, but seriously leave pc out of the mix. OPK, chams, etc. will literally ruin the console multiplayer experience just as it has in the past. Not to mention imbalance, pc will always have the upper hand with additional controls/macros, precision aim unavailable to competitors using a controller (scuff wont save you from the slaughter). This may come as a surprise, but if I was Sony, I'd say to that idea, 'NO 1/10 unsub unfollow'.
